entry.title: LMS Expert! Please guide - Scheduled offerings Question
entry.content: I am working on retrieving all scheduled offerings from SF LMS. I found the following API, but it requires an instructorID as input: /learning/odatav4/public/admin/scheduledoffering-service/v1/ScheduledToTeachClasses?$filter=sttcCriteria/fromDate eq 1756473000000 and sttcCriteria/toDate eq 1856498200000 and sttcCriteria/instructorID eq 'instructorID' &expand=segments($select=*)&$select=* The challenge is that to get all scheduled offerings, I would need to call this API for every instructorID. However, I haven’t been able to find any API that provides a list of instructorIDs. Has anyone come across a way to retrieve instructorIDs, or is there an alternative approach to get all scheduled offerings without filtering by instructorID?

entry.title: Odata response with null entity with HRIS emp central permission ON
entry.content:
{
  "d": {
    "__metadata": {
      "uri": "https://{companyurl}/odata/v2/PerPerson('UseriD')",
      "type": "SFOData.PerPerson"
    },
    "personIdExternal": "{perPerson}", //This value is present
    "lastModifiedDateTime": "/Date(1305980631000+0000)/",
    "createdDateTime": "/Date(1305980630000+0000)/",
    "createdOn": "/Date(1305980630000)/",
    "countryOfBirth": null,
    "placeOfBirth": null,
    "lastModifiedBy": "v4admin",
    "dateOfBirth": null,
    "customString2": null,
    "perPersonUuid": "*************",
    "lastModifiedOn": "/Date(1305980631000)/",
    "customString1": null,
    "createdBy": "v4admin",
    "regionOfBirth": null,
    "customLong2": null,
    "personId": "*****",
    "customLong1": null,
    "customString1Nav": {
      "__deferred": {
        "uri": "https://{CompanyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson('UseriD')/customString1Nav"
      }
    },
    "personalInfoNav": {
      "results": []
    },

 

Hi,

I have a permission role set up in SAP SuccessFactors with following rules:

  • Employee central HRIS Odata permission is given to the user.
  • The granted user is given to a group containing a single user
  • The target population is selected as All employees
  • The effective dated entities [Personal Information] and employee data [Biographical information] is selected

Although I am getting a 200-response code when calling the endpoint https://{companyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson({userID}),

The personalInfoNav is null.

entry.title: Integration Suite OData PATCH
entry.content:
Hi,

I am struggling for quite some time to sole issues regarding OData services. Now my problem is with Sales Order Item. I want to change Reject Reason in item, but with OData adapter.

This is my connection:

processing:

Content Modifier before:

 

This is from log:
odata:PATCH_ENTRY?serviceUri=${exchangeProperty.endpoint}/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/
&resourcePath=RAW(A_SalesOrderItem(SalesOrder='0000000578',SalesOrderItem='000010'))
&alias=RAW(CUC_BO_SO_0109)
&authenticationType=Basic
&retrieveAllPages=true
&oDataMethod=PATCH_ENTRY
&contentType=application/atom+xml
&componentContentType=xml
&receiveTimeOut=60000&proxyType=default
&SystemQueryOption=RAW(sap-client=100&$format=json)
&retryOnFailure=false
&allowRequestHeaders=false
&setErrorResponseBody=true
&isKeyAutoGenerated=true
&allowResponseHeaders=false
&isCSRFEnabled=true
&serviceType=HCIOData&allowHttpSuccessPassThrough=true
&adapterVersion=1.26.0
&whitelistRequestHeaders=RAW(Accept:application/atom+xml|If-Match:*|content-type:application/atom+xml;type=entry)
&validateSystemQueryOption=true
&enableTLSSessionReuse=true
&enableMPLAttachments=false
&enableKeyManagerCache=true

 

And at the end error:

Error Details
com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: Request Payload Parsing Failed for one of the reason: (1) Either the OData metadata content available in the server is outdated OR (2) The request payload seems to be incorrect. Error Details : Entity Set entry not found in the edmx.

Thank you

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial Account Published Services Not Working
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have published few services in SAP BTP Trial Account, and these services are not working at all but old services are working fine.

  1. For V2 service the preview is total blank
  2. For V4 it is popping up "Could not open App. Please try again later."
  3. For Service URL it is giving error "The request has been blocked by UCON.

Please find the attached screenshot for reference.  Has anyone experienced this issue.

entry.title: What end-to-end testing tools are best for SAP BTP (BAS) applications with CDS views and SAPUI5?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) projects deployed on SAP BTP that use CDS views as the data model and SAPUI5 for the front end.

I would like to implement end-to-end testing for these applications. I am familiar with general-purpose tools like Playwright or WebdriverIO, but I am not sure if they are the best fit when testing applications in the SAP ecosystem (especially those with CDS/OData services and SAPUI5).

  • Has anyone successfully used Playwright or WebdriverIO for BAS/SAPUI5 projects?

  • Are there recommended frameworks or libraries specifically designed for UI5 applications?

  • What are the best practices for handling such tests?

  • Any tutorials, examples, or community resources you could share?

Thanks in advance for your insights!

entry.title: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take input as a structure and send back array of data
entry.content:
Dear Community,                                                                                                                                                                          I have a requirement where I want take a structure of fields as input and respond back with different structure or array of another structure/data. And this I want to create using ODATA v4 with latest ABAP. 

Can someone help me by providing some working sample piece of code and steps which needs to be followed?

I appreciate your response in advance.

Regards,                                                                                                                                                                             Omkar

entry.title: TRL System OData V4 Service Group does not get published why? (Error 403 and 502)
entry.content:
I'm working on the LG getting-started-with-creating-an-sap-fiori-elements-app-based-on-an-odata-v4-rap-service. 

First of all, the Generator Class didn't work, so I tried to duplicate/create the necessary RAP-entities into the Package assigned to me from another package which runs successfully. Now I'm stuck trying to understand why I cannot open the Preview. I get 403 and 502 error codes in the browser, the feed reader also suggests that my service group is not being published although ADT seems to think it has been. The referenced SAP note 1797736 is not being displayed at the moment. 

Any more ideas what could be the problem or how to proceed?

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

entry.title: F0797 App Extension OData Service - Manage Billing Docs.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have successfully created a Fiori Extension Project in BAS for Fiori App F0797: Manage Billing Documents. I added a new custom action/button to the worklistview. The new button will update the billing date for the records selected in the worklist. In my app preview, the button is displayed correctly, and the popup is also working as expected and provided the user with the option to select the new billing date.

How to tie this to the backend SAP system for processing?
The OData project in SEGW is SD_CUSTOMER_INVOICES_MANAGE. My question is, do I need to create a copy of this project and add my custom logic in the DPC_EXT class?  Or, am I able to create a new service entirely and add it to my Extension project in BAS? The new service would only be enabled for my custom action/button. What is the preferred approach when extending Fiori Apps which are UI5 based?

Attached are my worklist custom controller. 

Edit-----*

I figured out a solution for this and it is working as expected.

Br,
Jared

entry.title: S/4HANA API for A_JournalEntryItemBasic changes order of results if $select fields
entry.content:
When I query using the REST API the A_JournalEntryItemBasic resource of the API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV service, if I change the list of fields to retrieve, using the $select parameter, then the order of the results change. Even if I add an $orderby !

For example, I expect that a GET request to this two URLs return the same record (same ID, same URI) but represented with a different set of fields. Because I'm passing `$top=1` so only the first result should be returned:

  1. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=ID%2CLedger%2CLedgerName%2CSourceLedger%2CLedg
    erFiscalYear%2CControllingArea%2CControllingAreaName%2CCompanyCode%2CCompanyCodeName%2CGLAccount%2CGLAccountName&%24orderby=Ledger
  2. GET https://sandbox.api.sap.com//s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic?%24top=1&%24select=WBSElement%2CWBSElementDescription%2CPartnerCo
    mpanyCode%2CPartnerCompanyCodeName%2CCostCtrActivityType%2CCostCtrActivityTypeName%2COrderID%2CLedger&%24orderby=Ledger

But two different URIs are returned. First:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'ID': '.1~0C.3~0L.4~2018.5~A000.7~1010.9~0000000001',
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'LedgerName': 'Management Accounting',
 'SourceLedger': '0L',
 'LedgerFiscalYear': '2018',
 'ControllingArea': 'A000',
 'ControllingAreaName': 'Controlling Area A000',
 'CompanyCode': '1010',
 'CompanyCodeName': 'BestRun DE',
 'GLAccount': '1',
 'GLAccountName': 'Paybls Domestic'}

And second:

{'__metadata': {'id': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'uri': "https://sandbox.api.sap.com/s4hanacloud/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV/A_JournalEntryItemBasic('.1~0C.71~.73~.75~.77~')",
  'type': 'API_JOURNALENTRYITEMBASIC_SRV.A_JournalEntryItemBasicType'},
 'Ledger': '0C',
 'WBSElement': '',
 'WBSElementDescription': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCode': '',
 'PartnerCompanyCodeName': '',
 'CostCtrActivityType': '',
 'CostCtrActivityTypeName': '',
 'OrderID': ''}

The OData specification says:

Select System Query Option ($select): A data service URI with a $select System Query Option identifies the same set of entities as a URI without a $select query option; however, the presence of a $select query option specifies that a response from the data service SHOULD return a subset, as identified by the value of the $select query option, of the properties that would have been returned had the URI not included a $select query option.

What am I missing?

 

UPDATE:
Apparently what I take as a row ID is actually a GENERATED_ID : a special property name used in OData services to uniquely identify aggregated or grouped data records. When you request aggregated data in an OData service, a GENERATED_ID property is automatically created for each resulting group. This ID serves as a unique key for that aggregated record, allowing you to request the same aggregated data again by referencing this ID.

So now, I don't know how to identify rows and thus how to match two rows from different queries. Can I rely on the order of the results?

entry.title: Consuming two ODatas from different destinations
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m facing an auth/routing issue after deploying a Fiori/UI5 app to BTP CF. Locally everything works: calls to an OData V2 service must go through a Destination named DEST (BasicAuthentication with a technical user), while other OData calls go through s4destination (xsuaa).

Symptom (only after deploy): calls sometimes reach the backend as my own user instead of the technical user from DEST — or the opposite (all calls go as the technical user), even when I’m calling the “DEST” dataSource.

This is my destination configuration:

 

The OData I'm trying to call is FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV. In deploy it goes through the s4destrt destination, which is the one I use for the others OData calls. This is my xd-app.json: 

  {
    "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
    "authenticationMethod": "route",
    "logout": {
      "logoutEndpoint": "/do/logout",
      "logoutPage": "/"
    },
    "sessionTimeout": 60,
    "routes": [
      {
        "source": "^/DEST/(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "destination": "DEST",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "csrfProtection": false
      },
      {
        "source": "^/s4destination/(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "destination": "s4destination",
        "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
        "csrfProtection": false
      },      
      {
        "source": "^/resources/(.*)$",
        "target": "/resources/$1",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "destination": "ui5"
      },
      {
        "source": "^/test-resources/(.*)$",
        "target": "/test-resources/$1",
        "authenticationType": "none",
        "destination": "ui5"
      },
      {
        "source": "^(.*)$",
        "target": "$1",
        "service": "html5-apps-repo-rt",
        "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
      }
    ]
  }
 
This is my manifest: 
"dataSources": {
"mainService": {
"uri": "s4destination/sap/opu/odata4/sap/odata1/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "4.0" }
},
"FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV": {
"uri": "DEST/sap/opu/odata/sap/FAC_GL_DOCUMENT_POST_SRV/",
"type": "OData",
"settings": { "odataVersion": "2.0" }
}
}
 
Can you help me solve this issue? Thanks!

entry.title: CPI: OData v2 PATCH request includes key in body
entry.content:
I'm creating an iflow using the OData v2 adapter to connect to S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 (on-premise) using the SalesOrder (A2X) API package. The iflow needs to update a Sales Order with a delivery block.

For this I'm using a PATCH request. This request is automatically configured through the wizard fetching the metadata from the S/4HANA server:

The payload data is set via a message mapping taking the values from exchange properties, being mapped to the XSD generated from the above PATCH configuration:

Given that 'SalesOrder' is the key field it is marked as mandatory in the EDMX and a value is required.

The problem I'm facing is that the query going to S/4HANA correctly has the key field in the url, but also (incorrectly) in the body:

request:
PATCH /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_SALES_ORDER_SRV/A_SalesOrder(SalesOrder='123')

body:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<A_SalesOrder>
  <A_SalesOrderType>
    <SalesOrder>123</SalesOrder>
    <DeliveryBlockReason>50</DeliveryBlockReason>
  </A_SalesOrderType>
</A_SalesOrder>

To which S/4HANA responds: "Key field SALESORDER must not be changed.". This error is correct according to the OData specification mentioning that key fields should not be part of the body. This is also confirmed by the API docs: "You must always provide all key fields in the URL to identify the entity." A simple test case without that field in the body goes through fine.

I know that I can easily get around this by using custom logic etc, but I'm looking for a clean, out-of-the-box solution.

Is there a specific configuration in the OData v2 adapter to make it remove key fields from the body for patch calls? Removing the field from the 'Fields' setting does not make a difference.

entry.content:

@ObjectModel.dataCategory: #VALUE_HELP

Could you please help me understand how to resolve this INTERNAL_ERROR?  is this a configuration issue or a system problem?

Best regards,
Ashok

entry.title: How to Maintain User Context When Making Programmatic Draft Queries in SAP CAP?
entry.content:
How to Maintain User Context When Making Programmatic Draft Queries in SAP CAP?

Problem Summary

When creating drafts via authenticated OData requests in SAP CAP, subsequent programmatic queries using srv.run() fail to find those drafts. The root cause is that srv.run() defaults to 'anonymous' user context instead of preserving the authenticated user from the HTTP request.

Detailed Description

I have a draft-enabled entity in my CAP application. When I create a draft through an authenticated OData POST request (user: 'alice'), the draft is successfully created with DraftAdministrativeData.InProcessByUser = 'alice'.

However, when I try to query for this draft programmatically using srv.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts)), CAP automatically adds the filter InProcessByUser = 'anonymous' instead of 'alice', causing the query to return no results.

Reproduction

I've created a minimal CAP application that demonstrates this issue:

Repository: https://github.com/urlmic/cap-draft-user-context-issue

Schema (db/schema.cds)

namespace my.bookshop;

entity Books {
  key ID     : UUID;
      title  : String(100);
      author : String(100);
}

Service (srv/catalog-service.cds)

using my.bookshop from '../db/schema';

service CatalogService {
  @odata.draft.enabled
  entity Books as projection on bookshop.Books;
}

Test (test/draft-context.test.js)

const cds = require('@sap/cds');

describe('Draft User Context Issue', () => {
  const { axios } = cds.test(__dirname + '/..');

  let draftID;

  // Authenticate as 'alice' user
  axios.defaults.auth = { username: 'alice', password: 'alice' };

  test('Create draft via OData (authenticated as alice)', async () => {
    const { data } = await axios.post('/odata/v4/catalog/Books', {
      title: 'Test Book',
      author: 'Test Author'
    });

    expect(data.IsActiveEntity).toBe(false);
    expect(data.HasActiveEntity).toBe(false);
    draftID = data.ID;
  });

  test('Query draft programmatically (loses user context)', async () => {
    const srv = await cds.connect.to('CatalogService');
    const { Books } = srv.entities;

    // This query fails because it uses 'anonymous' user instead of 'alice'
    const draft = await srv.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts).where({ ID: draftID }));

    console.log('Draft found:', draft);
    expect(draft).toBeDefined();
    expect(draft.length).toBe(1); // FAILS: Returns empty array []
  });

  test('Query draft via OData (keeps user context)', async () => {
    // This works fine because the HTTP request carries 'alice' user context
    const { data } = await axios.get(`/odata/v4/catalog/Books(ID=${draftID},IsActiveEntity=false)`);

    expect(data).toBeDefined();
    expect(data.IsActiveEntity).toBe(false); // PASSES
  });
});

Test Results

✅ Test 1: Create draft via OData (passes)
❌ Test 2: Query draft programmatically (fails - returns [])
✅ Test 3: Query draft via OData (passes)

SQL Evidence

With cds.env.log.sql = true, I can observe the different user contexts:

Draft Creation (works):

INSERT INTO my_bookshop_Books_drafts (...) VALUES (...)
INSERT INTO my_bookshop_Books_drafts_DraftAdministrativeData 
  (InProcessByUser, ...) VALUES ('alice', ...)

OData Query (works):

SELECT ... FROM my_bookshop_Books_drafts 
WHERE ID = ? AND DraftAdministrativeData.InProcessByUser = 'alice'

Programmatic Query (fails):

SELECT ... FROM my_bookshop_Books_drafts 
WHERE ID = ? AND DraftAdministrativeData.InProcessByUser = 'anonymous'

What I've Tried

  1. Using srv.run() directly:

    const srv = await cds.connect.to('CatalogService');
const draft = await srv.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts).where({ ID: draftID }));
// Result: Uses 'anonymous' user context

  2. Creating a transaction with srv.tx():

    const srv = await cds.connect.to('CatalogService');
const tx = srv.tx();
const draft = await tx.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts).where({ ID: draftID }));
// Result: Still uses 'anonymous' user context

  3. Using srv.tx({ user: new cds.User.Privileged() }):

    const tx = srv.tx({ user: new cds.User.Privileged() });
// Result: TypeError - cannot read properties of undefined

Expected Behavior

When user 'alice' creates a draft via an authenticated OData request, programmatic queries within the same test context should use the same user context ('alice'), allowing me to query for drafts created by that user.

Questions

  1. How do I properly maintain user context when making programmatic draft queries?
  2. Is there a way to pass the HTTP request's user context to srv.run() or tx.run()?
  3. What is the recommended pattern for querying drafts in service handlers or custom logic?

Environment

  • CAP Version: @SAP/cds ^9
  • Node.js: v18+
  • Test Framework: Jest with @cap-js/cds-test ^0.4.0
  • Database: SQLite (in-memory)

Additional Context

This issue occurs in integration tests where I need to verify that business logic correctly handles draft entities. The draft queries work fine when called via OData (HTTP requests carry user context), but fail when called programmatically (no user context propagation).

I've reviewed the CAP documentation on draft handling, but couldn't find clear guidance on maintaining user context for programmatic queries.

Any help or guidance would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition from BTP app
entry.content:
I’m building a BTP CAP application which should retrieve the PDF printout of an Outbound Delivery (FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1 template )out of an S/4HANA Cloud, public edition system.

Since no direct API exists (like for billing documents Overview | Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF | SAP Business Accelerator Hub), as per my understanding I’m left with three options:

  1. Recreate the same form I have on S/4HANA on BTP with SAP Forms Service by Adobe
  2. Get the PDF directly from CA_OC_OUTPUT_REQUEST_SRV Service
  3. Create a small custom ABAP service to be called from BTP which, given a specific delivery number, could return a PDF

I tried all those routes, but couldn’t succeed for various reasons:

  1. SAP Forms Service by Adobe
    1. it seems I can’t reuse the layout I made since the service only accept only one file, whereas mine is comprised of a master form and a content for
    2. even if I could recreate it from scratch I don't know how I can get data out of the standard Data Provider (FDP_V2_DELIV_NOTE_LO_GLO_GEN_SRV) to pass it to the layout
  2. this does not seem to be a released API, therefore I think I could have a problem with Communication Arrangement technical user
  3. on Premise FM like ‘FP_JOB_OPEN’ etc.. are obviously forbidden, so I tried with proper classes like cl_fp_form_reader like suggested in Note 3355397 - No support for custom form templates in S/4 HANA Cloud Developer Extensibility - SAP for Me, however,  since the form was created using Maintain Form Template App, I tried to create in ADT, but no standard Data Provider can be chosen and I can’t even create my own copy with the proper annotations (as explained in note 3650179 - [2508] Cannot select data provider in ADT Form dialog - SAP for Me) because I can’t open SEGW on a Public Cloud environment.

I’ve hit a dead end. Can someone share a tip?

entry.title: How can I connect SAP Customer Data Platform (CDP) to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently exploring integration options between SAP Customer Data Platform (CDP) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to enable analytics and dashboarding based on CDP data. 

As far as I know, SAC does not currently offer a direct live connection to SAP CDP. However, I’m trying to understand what would be the best possible architecture to bring CDP data into SAC — for example, by using SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) (or any equivalent integration layer).

My goal is to:

  • Enable reporting and visualization of CDP data in SAC

  • Stay within SAP’s supported and recommended integration patterns

I would like to know:

  1. Is there any standard or recommended approach for connecting SAP CDP to SAC (directly or indirectly)?

  2. Can SAP CPI act as an intermediary layer — for example, exposing an OData API or using the SAC Data Import Service API to push data into SAC?

If anyone has implemented a similar scenario or can share documentation, architecture examples, or experiences, that would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your insights.

Recep

entry.title: Error: Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 ()
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
Hello @Jitendra_Kansal78, 

I built a SAP MDK Mobile Application via the BAS. 
To do so I created two OData services in my ERP system and two destinations in my BTP account.

The creation of the apps via the CRUD template went well and also the deployment on Android and iOS mobile devices worked perfectly fine. 

I now saw that you can also choose to deploy the app as a Cloud Foundry web application. 
Initially the deployment is completed successfully, but then, when I open the generated link, I get this error message at the top of the main page:
Failed to initialize application data service - Error: 500 (); GET /nsJobViewerBAS_CRUD/job_infos/ Internal Server Error

I saw these two posts:

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/error-500-get-nsdemosampleapp-com-sap-edm-sampleservice-v2-internal-server/qaq-p/12753245
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/failed-to-initialize-application-data-service/qaq-p/12684025

But no real solution can be found there. I also tried to change the CSDL Options > select IgnoreAllAnnotations & ignoreAllReferences. but sadly it did not work for me. 

Please let me know if I should provide any details.

Best regards,

Manuel

entry.title: OData Services ABAP RESTful application programming model
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

 

I’m working on the S4D400 exercise where we create a subpackage  ZS4D400 and copy the table  /LRN/S4D400_APT to our own package.

However, I noticed that my main package S4D400 doesn’t exist in my ABAP environment.

Should I create this package manually, or is it supposed to be pre-delivered by the system?

I need some suggestions how to find that package. so that I can create the application.

Thanks in advance
Sumanth.
